Felix Marks
61 York Mansions, London, SW11 4BW, England | 07545 293 325 | felixmarksuk@gmail.com
I am passionate about helping organisations protect themselves from the latest and severest forms of cyber attack. I have enjoyed a highly successful career in technical sales (presales) with disciplines including Cyber Security, Network Management and IT Systems Management. I have been spearheading the use of Ethical Hacking tools and techniques at IBM to demonstrate QRadar's ability to detect advanced cyber threat, and created the QRadar ATT&CK Demo, for which I won a 2019 IBM Outstanding Technical Achievement Award and a 2020 IBM EMEA Oscar. I am passionate about helping organisations protect themselves from the latest and severest forms of cyber attack. I have enjoyed a highly successful career in technical sales (presales) with disciplines including Cyber Security, Network Management and IT Systems Management. I have been spearheading the use of Ethical Hacking tools and techniques at IBM to demonstrate QRadar's ability to detect advanced cyber threat, and created the QRadar ATT&CK Demo, for which I won a 2019 IBM Outstanding Technical Achievement Award and a 2020 IBM EMEA Oscar. I have excellent interpersonal and presentation skills with a creative edge, including a patent award. I am currently working towards CREST Certified Infrastructure Tester certification.
MSc Concurrent Engineering in Electronic Systems, Bournemouth University / 1995
BA (Hons) Philosophy, University of East Anglia / 1992
IBM, London, England
QRadar Cyber Security Analytics Specialist / 2017 - present
Working in the UK & Ireland with SOC customers including financial services, mining, government, utilities, healthcare and telco, IBM business partners and IBM MSSPs:
Technical sales architect for the QRadar SIEM, Resilient SOAR and X-Force Threat Intelligence Insights toolset to secure on-prem and cloud technologies including Windows, Linux and IP networking, Next Generation Firewalls, EDR, IDPS, Antivirus, Proxies, and Operational Technology (OT)
Creating and delivering my MITRE aligned QRadar ATT&CK Demo using hacking tools such as Metasploit, PowerShell Empire, Mimikatz, dnscat2 and Nishang, to demonstrate QRadar's ability to detect advanced cyber threat, including PowerShell exploits and DNS Tunneling
Promoting cognitive and machine learning capabilities including Network Behaviour Anomaly Detection (NBAD), User Behaviour Analytics (UBA), DNS Analytics and Watson Advisor (automatic attack anatomisation and MITRE mapping)
Researching and reporting PowerShell based Windows vulnerabilities
Teaching Ethical Hacking to IBM’s Security Business Unit
Supporting the CyberFirst initiative, a UK Government and IBM partnership student scheme, inspired and led by the National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) which aims to support and prepare undergraduates for a career in cyber security
IBM, London, England
Tivoli Netcool Architect / 2006 - 2017
Pre-sales architect and account management for Tivoli Cyber Security, Network Management, and ITSM activities for the UK Telco Sector, including Vodafone Mobile, Vodafone Enterprise, British Telecom, O2 UK, Virgin Media, Everything Everywhere, Easynet and Sky Network Services:
Leading customer engagements with cutting-edge Telco Predictive Network Analytics, Netcool Network Security Compliance and NFV/SDN Management capabilities
Performing presales of Network and Endpoint Compliance Management, SIEM, Fault Management, ITSM and Network Performance Management solutions
Delivering complex multi-product presentations, Proof of Technologies, Proof of Concepts, RFIs and RFPs
Identifying new software sales opportunities
Owning strategic customer relationships
Creating customer references
Micromuse, Sydney, Australia
Netcool Presales Lead / 2003 - 2006
Led Netcool pre-sales activities (Cyber Security, Fault and Performance Management) in Telstra, Vodafone (Australia and New Zealand) and Telecom New Zealand:
Won against Micromuse’s biggest competitor to establish Netcool as Telstra’s strategic network management standard
Recruited and managed local technical team
New customers included Telstra Mobile, Telstra DSL, Telstra Kaz, Vodafone Australia and Vodafone NZ. Incremental business was acquired from Telstra BCNM, Telstra SSDM, Telecom New Zealand and Telstra Clear
Acted as Micromuse’s regional spokesperson, giving published press interviews with Technology and Business, Computerworld, Infoworld, CommsWorld
Micromuse, London, England
Netcool Presales Lead, London, England / 1998 - 2002
Performed Netcool pre-sales as well as creating and managing a successful team of geographically dispersed pre-sales engineers:
Helped develop Micromuse’s first SIEM offering with British Telecom for their managed firewall service offering
Led architectural direction for one of Micromuse’s largest single implementations (South Africa Telkom)
Recruited and managed local technical teams (Sweden, Denmark, Norway, UK, Dubai and South Africa) to perform pre-sales and channel management
Displaced BT’s incumbent event management product by obtaining the following new customers: BT Exact, BT Ignite Solutions, BT Ignite, BT Ignite Data Centres, BT Broadcast Services, BT Concert, BT Openworld, BT Cellnet (now O2 UK)
Managed channel technical engagement within BT Account in UK and all accounts in Nordics, Middle East and Africa, including: CGEY, Logica, AU-Systems (Teleca), Accenture, Cisco, Cygate, BISTech, Dimension Data and Lattis
Micromuse, London, England
Professional Services Consultant / 1995- 1998
Performed post-sales of Micromuse’s reseller product offerings:
Post-sales consultant for Remedy (Remedy Accredited Consultant), Check Point FireWall-1, Netscout, HP NNM, and Sun hardware and software
3rd line support to Micromuse’s helpdesk on all re-seller products
Designed and implemented Micromuse’s helpdesk using Remedy ARS
Patent Award
Method and system for predicting causes of network service outages using time domain correlation (GB2387066)
Interests
Sailing (published author), music and travel
